definition: verification code/CAPTCHA, a type of challenge-response test (computing)
to examine/to test/to check
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]
weight/number/code/to pile/to stack/classifier for length or distance (yard), happenings etc

sentences.english: This are vote links where you can see the reCaptcha.
sentences.chinese: 這是投票的鏈接，你可以看到驗證碼。

sentences.english: This software should submit information to a large number of text ad sites with captcha.
sentences.chinese: 該軟件應提交資料的網站的文字廣告和大量的驗證碼。

sentences.english: Perhaps Captcha or another security measure to prevent such spamming will be instituted to prevent any such issues.
sentences.chinese: 也許通過驗證碼或其他措施可以有效防止類似問題。

definition: well-tried/time-tested
to disembark/to off-load cargo/to uninstall (software)
to report the loss of something
mojibake (nonsense characters displayed when software fails to render text according to its intended character encoding)
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
to err/to dial a wrong number/to make a typo
to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
to give sb a demerit
to place an order (commerce)
to accept delivery of goods/to pick up goods
to issue a card/(slang) to reject a guy or a girl/to chuck
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to place an order/to order/an order (of goods)
(of cargo etc) to load
to agree tacitly/tacit approval/default (setting)
